page.title: 06Canvey - The Lake (1)
page.content: Once set in a rural area with only a few scattered weather-boarded cottages nearby or overlooking, the lake is now surrounded by high density urban housing estates built in the last 15 years. It is also a part of the sea-defences being a storm drain as {Hilton Dyke} runs into it from the North bank. There are pumping stations at either end. A pathway along the banks are heavily used since then the lake has been subjuct to disastrous ecological changes due to extra silt being deposited, the overgrowth of reeds leading to stagnant water, extensive rubbish dumping from people and excrement from domestic pets. The area has been the subject of much local concern when it was realised that the state of deterioration could not be allowed to continue.
